result.execSummary:
The defendant Evan William Van Klei was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Huber granted. *Report clean & sober. *May transfer to McHenry County, IL. or Walworth County. ***11-06-2017 Amended to also include transfer to Sheboygan County. Original report date was stayed pending appeal, stay lifted, and new report date on or before 11-20-2017.
**Electronic monitoring request is not ordered but the Court is not forbidding it either.
If after 12 months the defendant has paid the fine and costs in full and has had no criminal violations, the defendant may petition the court for Expungement 973.015.
*Bond and restitution paid is to be applied and paid out as requested.

records.addlTxt: to Court from Atty Breedlove

Defendant Evan William Van Klei in court with attorney Tristan Susan Breedlove.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states motion and asks the court to lift the stay and order the defendant to start serving his 6 month jail service today.  
Atty Breedlove responds and makes arguments.  Atty Hendee makes arguments and asks the court to lift the stay.

BY THE COURT:  Court grants the State's motion and will lift the stay.  However, that stay of jail sentence will be stayed for 30 days.
  Report on or before November 20, 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
May serve in McHenry County, Walworth County or Sheboygan County

Supplement to Disposition (Restitution)

Defendant Evan William Van Klei in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this is an argued sentencing.  Atty Hendee states that all parties are prepared to proceed today.  Atty Gumz agrees.
Atty Hendeee files an amended information to amend Ct. 1 to Misd. Battery.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the amended Ct. 1.  Counts 2, 3 & 4 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Gumz agrees and enters a No Contest plea.  Defendant agrees.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1.   Counts 2, 3 & 4 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Hendee states that the victim was not able to be here today but his wife is and would like to make a statement to the court.  Atty Hendee files a restitution supplement with the court.  Atty Gumz has no argument with the restitution requested.
Exhibits 1 - 5 marked by Atty Hendee.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations. Atty Hendee objects to expungment if the defense is requesting it.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.  
Defendant makes a statement to the court.
Atty Gumz asks the court to approve expungment with conditions.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 1:  Court orders 6 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
  Report on or before November 4, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
May transfer to McHenry County, IL or Walworth County
Credit = 3 days
Court Costs = $243.00
Restitution as per the supplement
bond and restitution to be applied and paid out as requested per the supplement

**Electronic montioring request is not ordered but the court is not forbidding it either.
Counts 2, 3 & 4 to be dismissed and read-in.

  If after 12 months the defendant has paid the fine, costs and restitution in full and has had no criminal violations, the defendant may petition the court for Expungement 973.015.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 8, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Evan William Van Klei in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he thought that there would be a plea with an argued sentence today; however, before court Atty Gumz stated that he would be requesting a reset today.  Atty Hendee objects to the reset.
Atty Gumz asks for more time to get sufficient information to the court and asks that this be set for plea/sentencing about 30 days out.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea/Sentencing
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Return date on August 17, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that parties believed that there was resolution today, however, as of yesterday the parties were made aware that there was not an agreement.
Atty Gumz agrees and states that his client resides in Illinois and will most likely be resolved and asks for 60 days.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Evan William Van Klei in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz requests matter be set for trial.  Should be able to resolve some issues in a few months.  Atty Hendee has no objection.  Will need time as there are restitution issues.
BY THE COURT:  Set for trial.  Bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

CONDITIONS AMENDED
Return date at 10-22-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Evan William Van Klei in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz states that a motion has been filed and he had hoped that that Motion would be heard today.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
bond continued.

MOTION:
Atty Gumz asks that the no contact be lifted with Joseph Kowalski as the victim is the defendant's squad leader.
Atty Hendee objects as the victim does not want any contact with the defendant.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant responds.  Atty Hendee makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Bond condition amended to:  Defendant is to request to change squads and there will be no contact with the victim except for Military duty.  Return date scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

BY THE COURT:  Reset

STATEMENT OF COMPLIANCE
Preliminary hearing at 08-19-2015 09:45 am
*Maintain absolute sobriety - zero tolerance.  *No contact with Joseph Kowalski.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  
Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing and Court accepts that waiver.

Defendant Evan William Van Klei by video, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests $500 cash bond with conditions.  
BY THE COURT:  Court sets cash bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 09:45 am.
